mdRecord.dcterms:title: All's for the best
All's for the best! be sanguine and cheerful
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Magnus, Charles.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Published by Chas. Magnus, 12 Frankfort St. N.Y.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil War song sheet in three verses, with chorus repeated after each; without music; printed in blue on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue.
First line: All's for the best! be sanguine and cheerful.
"Music Published by Firth, Pond & Co. 547 Broadway, New York" follows the title.
Advertisement: Ten illustrated Songs on Notepaper, mailed to any Address on receipt of 50 cts. Published by Chas. Magnus, 12 Frankfort St. N.Y.
Charles Magnus published as an individual at 12 Frankfort St., New York, between 1860 and 1867. Works which also include Washington, D.C. imprint were published about 1863 and 1864.
Hand-colored headpiece of a troop review, with 3 women standing in the foreground; Magnus 184. Cf. American song sheets, 23a..
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Ninth of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Conduct of life--Songs and music--Texts.
United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Songs and music--Texts.
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: New York (City), New York (State), United States
